skill.name: security-audit
skill.description: Detect common security vulnerabilities in code. Covers OWASP patterns, SQL injection, bare excepts, shell injection. Framework-agnostic.
skill.summary: Detect common security vulnerabilities in code. Covers OWASP patterns, SQL injection, bare excepts, ...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code examples for security best practices. No executable code, no network calls, no file access beyond its own documentation. Educational content only.

content.value_statement: Security vulnerabilities like SQL injection and shell commands put applications at risk. This skill identifies OWASP patterns and provides specific remediation steps to fix issues before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Detect SQL injection patterns in Python and TypeScript code
Identify shell injection vulnerabilities in subprocess calls
Find bare except blocks that hide errors and bugs
Detect hardcoded secrets in source code
Provide remediation code for each vulnerability type
Follow OWASP Top 10 and CWE guidelines
limitations: Does not execute or scan files automatically
Pattern matching is for reference only
Does not integrate with external security tools

use_cases.title: Review code during development
use_cases.description: Check your code for security issues before committing to version control.

use_cases.title: Train AI on vulnerability patterns
use_cases.description: Provide AI assistants with knowledge to identify security risks in code reviews.

use_cases.title: Create security test cases
use_cases.description: Build test suites that check for common vulnerability patterns in your codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Quick vulnerability scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this code for security vulnerabilities. Report findings with severity levels and remediation suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Database query review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these database queries for SQL injection. Rewrite any vulnerable queries using parameterized statements.

prompt_templates.title: Exception handling check
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this code for bare except blocks and overly broad exception handling. Provide fixed versions.

prompt_templates.title: Full security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive security audit following OWASP guidelines. Check for SQL injection, shell injection, XSS, path traversal, hardcoded secrets, and improper exception handling. Report all findings with severity and fixes.

output_examples.input: Scan this Python code for security issues: cursor.execute(f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}")

best_practices: Use parameterized queries for all database operations
Catch specific exceptions instead of bare except blocks
Validate and sanitize all user input before use
Never hardcode secrets in source code
anti_patterns: Bare except: blocks that catch all exceptions
User input passed directly to shell commands

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Python and TypeScript patterns are included. The concepts apply to any language with appropriate pattern adjustments.

faq.question: Does this skill scan my files automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides patterns and guidance. The AI assistant uses the knowledge during code review conversations.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: The patterns can be adapted for grep or linter rules. See the CI Integration section in SKILL.md for examples.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains no network code. All analysis happens locally by the AI assistant.

faq.question: How is this different from static analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered reasoning and context-aware guidance. Use with tools like bandit or eslint for automated scanning.

faq.question: Does this replace security training?
faq.answer: No. Use this skill alongside security training and professional audits for comprehensive coverage.
